races.poll_display: Polls close at 8 p.m. Eastern time.

counties.name: Kent
counties.absentee_method: Released as a separate subtotal as first report of the night

counties.name: New Castle
counties.absentee_method: Released as a separate subtotal as first report of the night

counties.absentee_method: Released as a separate subtotal as first report of the night

top_level.sentence: Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Delaware.
top_level.generatedText: Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Delaware.

winner_card_leadin.sentence: Race called by The Associated Press.
winner_card_leadin.generatedText: Race called by The Associated Press.

counties.sentence: We just received more votes from New Castle County.
counties.generatedText: We just received more votes from New Castle County.

eevp.sentence: Nearly all of the estimated vote total has been reported.
eevp.generatedText: Nearly all of the estimated vote total has been reported.

liveUpdates.text: Michelle Steel, Republican, wins California’s 48th Congressional District.
Biden’s lead in Pennsylvania is up to 0.7 points, or about 45,000 votes. He could still be on track to a lead of 100,000 votes when all the ballots are tallied up.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: How Joe Biden won the presidency: The bets he made about the party, the country and President Trump got him to this moment.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden’s victory was particularly sweet for supporters in three states he had to win: Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and Michigan.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: In rural Nebraska, a Biden win drew a big, red-state shrug. Many Republicans said they planned to show liberals that it was possible to simply move on when you lose.
liveUpdates.author: Dionne Searcey

liveUpdates.text: After tough losses in the House for Democrats, Conor Lamb, a moderate, says he’s “frustrated” by progressive rhetoric and policy proposals.
liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon

liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign announced that Representative Doug Collins, a staunch Trump ally who failed in his recent bid for a Senate seat, would lead its recount team in Georgia, where Trump trails by about 10,000 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens

liveUpdates.text: Trump continues to narrow the gap in Arizona, where he now trails by just 0.51 points. But he still isn’t doing well enough to overtake Biden — and the number of remaining mail and provisional ballots is dwindling.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: I ran into random federal employees I know. From various agencies. Again and again, they expressed enormous relief. A storm cloud is passing. Work of the government can continue.
liveUpdates.author: Eric Lipton

liveUpdates.text: Assuming Trump keeps doing rallies, which seems a good assumption, I wonder how they’ll be financed? It's doubtful he’d pay for them himself. These things are not inexpensive.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Fox News’s audience plummeted yesterday after Biden became president-elect.  During the Biden/Harris speeches, Fox had 3 million viewers, the lowest total of any network.
liveUpdates.author: John Koblin

liveUpdates.text: How the summer of protests played out at the polls: About nine of every 10 voters said the protests over police violence were important, but for very different reasons.
liveUpdates.author: Sabrina Tavernise

liveUpdates.text: Prominent Republicans are continuing to close ranks around President Trump, with Senator Ted Cruz of Texas saying that he still believed the president had “a path to victory.”
liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters

liveUpdates.text: From midnight until noon, the Trump campaign sent out a flurry of solicitations to supporters asking for money to fund its legal battles — at the rate of almost one every hour.
liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters

liveUpdates.text: The new county with the longest streak of picking presidential winners is Clallam County, Wash., population 77,000, which has gotten every election right since 1980.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: People have not historically hustled to spontaneous outdoor dance parties for Joe Biden. But beating President Trump can do strange things for a man’s reputation.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer

liveUpdates.text: Abigail Spanberger, Democrat, wins re-election in Virginia’s Seventh Congressional District.
Former Secretary of State Colin L. Powell, in a telephone interview: “Joe Biden brings back the American way of doing things. He’ll return us to who we are.”
liveUpdates.author: Eric Schmitt

liveUpdates.text: A White House official disputed reports that Jared Kushner had advised Trump to concede the election, saying Kushner was telling him to pursue “legal remedies” instead.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman

liveUpdates.text: George W. Bush congratulates Biden on his victory: “Though we have political differences, I know Joe Biden to be a good man, who has won his opportunity to lead and unify our country.”
liveUpdates.author: Peter Baker

liveUpdates.text: Congress’s inauguration committee is planning for an “outside, full-scale” event despite the pandemic, though it could be scaled back, the senator who chairs it said.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Biden has returned home from church and his team has called a lid, meaning he is not expected to appear in person again today.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: As Biden’s lead increases in Georgia, the remaining votes are coming from about 22,000 military and overseas voters, as well as provisional ballots that required additional information, such as missing IDs.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Biden is spending this Sunday morning, like most Sunday mornings, in church. He is set to be the nation’s second Catholic president.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Even though President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. now leads by more than 10,000 votes in Georgia, a recount is still expected there.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: With the votes still being tallied in Georgia, a once-red state that proved surprisingly difficult for Trump, Biden now leads by more than 10,000 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: On the morning of his first full day as president-elect, Joe Biden is now at church near his home in Delaware.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: The race may be called, but Philadelphia votes are continuing to build on Biden’s margin. Nearly 90 percent of a recent batch of votes went to Biden, adding 3,868 to his margin.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Trump was greeted at his golf course by a small handful of people, including two holding Trump 2020 signs. But another sign said, “Orange Crushed.”
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: Trump has arrived again at Trump National Golf Club in Virginia, even as he and his allies refuse to concede his loss and as Biden moves ahead with building his new administration.
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: Two runoff elections in Georgia set for early January will almost certainly determine which party has control of the Senate.
liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater

liveUpdates.text: President-elect Biden has shifted leftward since the primary, but he has hardly embraced the bold agenda of progressives.
liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember

liveUpdates.text: Next up: the scramble by foreign leaders to reach President-elect Biden with congratulatory phone calls. A lot of diplomatic prestige rides on getting in early.
liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler

liveUpdates.text: Biden is on the verge of adding Georgia to his winning electoral margin, with a narrow lead that is headed for a recount but is nevertheless a dramatic sign of the shifting politics of the South.
liveUpdates.author: Richard Fausset

liveUpdates.text: “Let this grim era of demonization in America begin to end here and now.” In his first speech as president-elect, Joe Biden stresses unity.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: There’s no evidence to support claims by Trump and his supporters that election observers were blocked from counting rooms.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: As Trump refused to concede defeat on Saturday, top Republican congressional leaders followed suit, refraining from releasing the customary statements of congratulations.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s already daunting odds for a change in the election result appeared to be dimming even further in key states in the ongoing vote counting on Saturday.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: For years, the battle for president has been waged in Ohio, a bellwether state that had predicted the outcome of every presidential election since 1964. Not this time.
liveUpdates.author: Sarah Mervosh

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden’s victory speech set a tone that was very different from President Trump’s, invoking his own spirituality and sharing credit with others.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden had to flip a few states that went to President Trump in 2016 and hold on to Democratic-leaning battleground states to win the election.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens

liveUpdates.text: In Democrat-dominated California, the ascension of Kamala Harris put renewed focus on contenders for the vice president-elect’s soon-to-be vacant Senate seat.
liveUpdates.author: Shawn Hubler

liveUpdates.text: In his victory speech, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. renewed his promise to be a president for all Americans in a polarized time.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens

liveUpdates.text: In her remarks, Vice President-elect Kamala Harris acknowledged “all the women who have worked to secure and protect the right to vote” and said: “And I stand on their shoulders.”
liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens

liveUpdates.text: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on the Biden transition and the left: It will “indicate whether the administration is taking a more open and collaborative approach” or an “icing-out approach.”
liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon

liveUpdates.text: Biden told a close ally two winters ago that he feared for the country’s soul. Top Dems feared that message would flop. But Biden trusted his instincts.
liveUpdates.author: Alex Burns

liveUpdates.text: For four years, whether people liked Trump or not, almost everyone I interviewed said they were exhausted. This is the first time in a long time when people en masse expressed relief.
liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s 2017 inaugural: “This American carnage stops right here and stops right now.” Biden tonight: “This is the time to heal in America.”
liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel

liveUpdates.text: The look on Joe Biden’s face watching those fireworks is definitely the look of a guy who got a job he wanted for at least 33 years. Maybe longer.
liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer

liveUpdates.text: Saturday’s split screen: Trump alone on a golf course; Biden surrounded by his family under fireworks.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: I’m guessing, watching this high-tech fireworks and drone finale, that the Biden campaign ended up with a fair amount of money in the bank.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Wilmington gets its moment at long last.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: After months of stilted, socially distanced and “drive-in” events, the Biden and Harris families — mostly masked — are allowing themselves one normal, exultant moment together onstage.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: Biden and his family get confetti and fireworks.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Assume the strategy from here on out is: This train is leaving the station, and a transition is taking place. Take the focus away from Trump and push the country into a new era.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: The song “Higher Love,” which is something of an anthem for Biden staffers, just finished playing. I imagine there was a lot of jubilation in that moment.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: This is a moving-on speech. The election is over; he’s reaching out to Trump voters. No need to acknowledge Trump’s non-concession.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden’s recitation of a hymn is a reminder that he does have an abiding faith that his opponents refused to acknowledge throughout the campaign.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: “Spread the faith,” Biden says, concluding perhaps the biggest speech of his life in the way he typically does.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Biden made no explicit mention of Trump in his speech — nor did he address the issue of Trump’s refusal to concede defeat.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: Biden reading a hymn really nails down that we are at a moment of transition in this nation.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: This is an upbeat, optimistic speech even in the midst of a very dark time in this nation. “We can do it: I know we can,” Biden says.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden said his mandate is to find common ground to “cooperate” with Republicans, pivoting to the center after embracing the party’s liberal wing during the general election.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: “Let this grim era of demonization in America begin to end, here and now.” That feels like the money quote, as we say.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: “Our work begins with getting Covid under control,” Biden says, at a moment when the United States is seeing record numbers of new infections.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: Big contrast with Trump: Controlling the coronavirus is critical to turning around the economy and getting the nation back on the right track, Biden says.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: A line Biden has been using for a while now but that has particular significance tonight: He says that he has run as a proud Democrat but will govern as an American president.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: In contrast to Trump, whose speeches are paeans of self-praise, Biden is crediting others, and allowed Harris to deliver a powerful speech without apparent concern about being upstaged.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: “This is the time to heal in America.” Biden is signaling the big early themes of his presidency. Covid-19. Health care. Racial justice. Climate change.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden is reaching out to Trump voters. “It’s time to put away the harsh rhetoric.”
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden describes his coalition as broad and diverse and appeals to Trump supporters: “Let’s give each other a chance.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: “I owe you, I owe you, I owe you everything.” In case there was any doubt, Biden is very different than the man he is replacing in the White House.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: “America has bent the arc of the moral universe more toward justice.” Biden is paraphrasing the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden comes right out establishing the legitimacy of his election: "They delivered us a clear victory, a convincing victory.” 74 million votes. A record.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden is hitting one of the central themes of his candidacy: that the stakes of the election transcended typical partisan divisions.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Biden comes trotting onto the stage. Finally getting a moment he has waited for for decades. And to Bruce Springsteen!
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. has taken the stage, 48 years to the day after he was elected to the U.S. Senate.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Harris: “The road ahead will not be easy.” Harris and Biden need to prepare Americans for tough times as the country confronts the pandemic.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: A century after the passage of the 19th Amendment, Kamala Harris is the vice president-elect, and says that while she may be the first woman to hold the office, she will not be the last.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: Harris talks about the “audacity” Biden showed in picking the first woman to be vice president — an Obama tribute there.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Harris tips to the historic nature of her election, talking about women and people of color “who throughout our history have paved the way for this moment tonight.”
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: It’ll be interesting to see how big a role Kamala Harris plays in a Biden White House. There have been a lot of powerful V.P.s in recent years, like Dick Cheney — and Joe Biden.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: “For four years you marched and organized for equality and justice, for our lives and for our planets. And then you voted,” Harris says. “You chose hope and unity, decency, science, and yes, truth.”
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Vice President-elect Kamala Harris is onstage in Wilmington.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Darrell Issa, Republican, wins California’s 50th Congressional District.
Trump concession or not, Biden already appears to have a full-scale, presidential-level Secret Service protection motorcade detail around him.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Biden’s motorcade is on its way to the Chase Center in Wilmington, where he will address the nation.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: As Biden supporters await the president-elect in Wilmington, many are waving large American flags and glow sticks.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Biden has extended his lead in Georgia to 9,160 votes with a net gain of 1,613 votes from DeKalb County. The statewide margin is still well within the range of a recount.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: Biden and Harris spoke to campaign staffers tonight, thanking them for their efforts. Biden spoke of the need to engage Trump supporters and other Republicans in an effort to unite the nation and move forward.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Aides say it’s not clear that Trump will adhere to customs like inviting Biden to the White House. But Biden, a previous vice president, is not in need of a tour.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman

liveUpdates.text: The drive-in rally in honor of Joe Biden in Wilmington is filling up. People are sitting in lawn chairs and on roofs of cars as they wait for him to speak here.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Former Senator Carl Levin, Democrat of Michigan, in a telephone interview: "It’s thrilling for the country to see a bully removed from office.”
liveUpdates.author: Eric Schmitt

liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign has filed a lawsuit alleging irregularities in some in-person voting in Maricopa County, Ariz., seeking to delay certification of results pending an investigation.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. is expected to speak tonight from a flag-bedecked outdoor stage near the Chase Center on the Riverfront, an event facility in Wilmington.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Progressives are preparing to unleash a campaign to pressure Biden over personnel and priorities, even as they wrestle with the need to be more realistic about expectations.
liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember

liveUpdates.text: As he prepares to lead a divided Washington, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will confront the ultimate test of how much times have changed, and how much he has.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Flegenheimer

liveUpdates.text: A few hours after Rudy Giuliani held a news conference in Philadelphia questioning the results, a small protest against him broke out in New York, the city he once led as mayor.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: The White House declared a “lid” at 3:59 p.m., indicating that President Trump has no intentions of appearing in public today to make a statement about his loss. (He could still tweet his feelings at any moment.)
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: Former Senator Sam Nunn, Democrat of Georgia, in a phone interview about Biden: “He can help heal the country. All of his instincts are to govern from the middle, from the center.”
liveUpdates.author: Eric Schmitt

liveUpdates.text: Another thing to watch: Will President Trump start losing followers on Twitter?
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Representative Steve Scalise of Louisiana, the No. 2 House Republican, takes a cue from President Trump, saying “the election is not final” until legal challenges are resolved.
liveUpdates.author: Catie Edmondson

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s motorcade arrived back at the White House, having driven past crowds of mostly Biden supporters. Trump waved at reporters as he entered the West Wing side entrance.
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: In many ways, he ran as the politician he has always been. And for one extraordinary election, that was enough. After a half-century in public life, Joe Biden is president-elect.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: What to watch: former Republican presidents and candidates validating Biden’s victory. In particular, George W. Bush. Mitt Romney was quick to do it. Watch for Bob Dole.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: On Fox News, Chris Wallace says the Trump campaign has presented no hard evidence of fraud. He notes that “tens of thousands of votes” would have be reversed to change the result.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum

liveUpdates.text: The reaction in America has been — predictably, given this election — divided. In big cities supporting Biden, celebrations erupted. Trump’s supporters voiced disappointment and disbelief.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Former President Jimmy Carter welcomed Biden’s election to the White House on Saturday, more than four decades after they first became political allies.
liveUpdates.author: Alan Blinder

liveUpdates.text: Obama spoke separately today with Biden and Harris, a representative confirms: “He congratulated them on their historic victory and told them how proud he was of the campaign they ran.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Representative Will Hurd, Republican of Texas, who is also retiring: “It’s time to come together. America has spoken and we must respect the decision.”
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Some Trump allies in the House have adopted his rhetoric: “It would be unwise to accept any outcome” before recounts and court reviews, said Rep. Jodey Arrington of Texas.
liveUpdates.author: Catie Edmondson

liveUpdates.text: Senator Lamar Alexander, Republican of Tennessee, who’s retiring: “After counting every valid vote and allowing courts to resolve disputes, it is important to respect and promptly accept the result.”
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Senator Mitt Romney, the 2012 Republican nominee, is not waiting for Trump to concede. He’s congratulated Biden and Harris and praised them “as people of good will and admirable character.”
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: Schumer, celebrating on the streets of Brooklyn during the call with Pelosi and Biden, held up his phone so the president-elect could hear the crowds cheering, an aide said.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senator Chuck Schumer called Biden at 12:45 p.m. to congratulate him and extend their support for working with his administration, an aide said.
liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos

liveUpdates.text: Barack Obama expressed confidence in his former vice president: “I know he’ll do the job with the best interests of every American at heart, whether or not he had their vote.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Senator Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, said the election wasn’t settled. “The media do not get to determine who the president is,” he said. “The people do.”
liveUpdates.author: Luke Broadwater

liveUpdates.text: With her ascension to the vice presidency, Kamala Harris will become the first woman and first woman of color to hold that office. A true milestone for the country.
liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember

liveUpdates.text: Jeb Bush just tweeted congrats to Biden. Watch for a bunch of these from Republicans as the day goes on. Not sure it will prompt Trump to concede, but the nation is moving on.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: “We’re just overjoyed — overjoyed and grateful,” says Jim Biden, Joe Biden’s younger brother, who said he has spoken with the president-elect. “He’s doing well.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Worth keeping in mind: Trump’s 2016 victory was narrow. (Lost the popular vote, and won the “blue wall” states by 80,000 votes.) Biden’s victory is substantial (and more conventional).
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: The mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, tweeted his congratulations to Joe Biden and Kamala Harris, writing,  “It’s time to get back to building bridges, not walls.”
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: Reaction is pouring in from around the world. The mayor of Paris, Anne Hidalgo, tweeted: “Welcome back America!”
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: In one of the first statements from a G.O.P. lawmaker, Representative Fred Upton of Michigan has affirmed a Biden victory. “I am raising my hand and committing to working with President-elect Biden,” he said.
liveUpdates.author: Catie Edmondson

liveUpdates.text: House Democrats are nearing the 218-seat threshold needed to hold onto the majority in the chamber, with Susie Lee of Nevada clinching her re-election.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Facebook put a notification atop its apps that said that Joe Biden was projected as the winner. It will appear for hundreds of millions of Americans on Facebook and Instagram.
liveUpdates.author: Mike Isaac

liveUpdates.text: Twitter has added an announcement in its “Explore” tab that Biden has been projected as the winner of the election, pointing to news outlets.
liveUpdates.author: Mike Isaac

liveUpdates.text: The street celebrations recall Obama’s election in 2008. But that was a celebration of Obama. This seems (without taking anything away from Biden) very much a celebration of Trump’s ouster.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: My inbox is full of Democratic lawmakers rushing to congratulate Biden and Harris, but Republicans are notably quiet. Little, if any, reaction so far.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. will address the nation at 8 p.m. Eastern time from Wilmington, his campaign says.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: We’re told that President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. was home with his family when he heard the news he had won. He has spoken with Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Rudy Giuliani baselessly tried to sow doubt about the veracity of the election at a news conference after the race was called, suggesting that courts should overturn the Pa. result.
liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden’s victory provides a lesson in resilience. He had run for the presidency unsuccessfully in 1988 and 2008 before finally achieving his goal in 2020.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Biden has also captured Nevada, a state where Democrats have built a powerful political machine in the last decade, largely thanks to labor unions.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: On Fox News, Bret Baier referred to “President-elect Biden.” Chris Wallace laughed and told viewers: “It’s going to take some getting used to.”
liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum

liveUpdates.text: “Obviously, he’s not going to concede,” Rudy Giuliani, the president’s personal lawyer, says at a news conference in Philadelphia that was scheduled before the race was called.
liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

liveUpdates.text: Minutes after networks declared Biden the winner, dozens of Trump’s supporters gathered at the Maricopa County recorder office here, where ballots were still being tabulated.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi, in a statement, says that voters “have elected a unifier who values faith, family and community, and who will work tirelessly to heal our nation.”
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Huge contrast with Clinton and Obama becoming president on waves of high hopes. Biden takes over a country in crisis, and voters know that. He may benefit from lowered expectations.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Nevada.
Joe Biden secures his election to the White House exactly 48 years to the day after he was first elected to the Senate.
liveUpdates.author: Shane Goldmacher

liveUpdates.text: At the Clark County elections headquarters in Las Vegas, where Trump supporters have rallied to demand that officials “stop the steal,” all is quiet right now. Not a single protester.
liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps

liveUpdates.text: Senator Chuck Schumer nods to the Georgia Senate runoffs: “A Democratic majority in the U.S. Senate would be the biggest difference maker to help President-elect Biden deliver for working families across the country.”
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. was elected the 46th president of the United States, making Donald J. Trump a one-term president after four years of tumult in the White House.
liveUpdates.author: Jonathan Martin

liveUpdates.text: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.: “It’s time for America to unite. And to heal. We are the United States of America. And there’s nothing we can’t do, if we do it together.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: A Biden statement, echoing themes he has pressed from the beginning: “With the campaign over, it’s time to put the anger and the harsh rhetoric behind us and come together as a nation.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Northampton County, Pa., a working-class area that once was home to Bethlehem Steel, is living up to its reputation as a bellwether. Biden appears to have flipped the county blue.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: The Drudge Report, a conservative website that has not always been kind to President Trump, used the inevitable headline: "YOU’RE FIRED!”
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign says it will continue with its legal challenges, even as most advisers realize it’s unlikely to change the outcome.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman

liveUpdates.text: The tipping-point state for Joe Biden was Pennsylvania, the state where he was born, where he kicked off his campaign and where he spent the last days of the race.
liveUpdates.author: Shane Goldmacher

liveUpdates.text: David Schweikert, Republican, wins re-election in Arizona’s Sixth Congressional District.
Conor Lamb, Democrat, wins re-election in Pennsylvania’s 17th Congressional District.
“Ecstatic — a great day for this country,” says Biden campaign manager Jennifer O'Malley Dillon, according to a pool report.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: The newest vote totals in Pennsylvania give Biden a lead of 34,414 votes, outside of the automatic recount threshold.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Fox News was the last major TV network to call the election for Biden, at 11:40 a.m. It was the only network that did not have its A-list anchor team on the air at 11 a.m.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum

liveUpdates.text: Biden was declared the winner just over an hour after Trump declared on Twitter and Facebook: “I WON THIS ELECTION, BY A LOT!” Both companies warned that was premature.
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: For all the nation’s divisions, Biden is on track to win a solid, even decisive election: a popular-vote margin of more than 4 million and potentially over 300 Electoral College votes.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s election as the 46th president comes after four polarizing years. He is taking over a country torn by a pandemic, an economic downturn and political strife.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: In New York City, as networks began to call the race, people cheered out their windows and banged pots — reminiscent of how they cheered essential workers early in the pandemic.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr. has been elected the 46th president of the United States.
Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Pennsylvania.
Trump was at his golf club in Virginia this morning as several networks and The Associated Press projected that he had lost his bid for re-election just before 11:30 a.m.
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: Minutes before TV networks called the race, Biden’s sister, Valerie Biden Owens, told us of this moment: “It’s wonderful. It’s a wonderful thing for us, but it’s a better thing for America.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: The Associated Press said Joe Biden had defeated President Trump in Pennsylvania and won the presidency. The Times is now reviewing The A.P.’s call.
liveUpdates.author: The New York Times

liveUpdates.text: At the Westin hotel in Wilmington, where the Biden team has set up shop, CNN is blaring and just called Pennsylvania, and the race, for Joe Biden.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: In Pennsylvania, an automatic recount is triggered when the margin is less than 0.5 percent of the total, which would currently be 33,674. At the moment, Biden’s lead is 30,908.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: The latest batch of Maricopa County votes was somewhat better for Trump than other recent batches, which means he closed the gap more than many observers expected.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: With the most recent release of votes in Arizona, Biden’s lead in the state now stands at 20,573 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: This is the first time Maricopa County voters chose a  Democrat for president in more than 70 years. My colleagues reported on one of the biggest political shifts in the country:
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Biden is still firmly ahead in Maricopa County (Phoenix), receiving about 50 percent of the votes tallied in the county, compared with 48 percent for Trump.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Arizona’s Maricopa County, by far the largest in the state, has just released what officials say is the last large report of tallied votes.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Trump wins the new Maricopa vote by 15.6 points. Still not good enough for him. Still not going to yield a projection, I don’t think.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Biden keeps inching closer to victory. He now leads in states worth over 300 electoral votes. So why hasn’t the race for president been called?
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Why is it taking so long to count in Alaska? Officials cite two reasons: the state’s late deadline for accepting absentee ballots and the process to ensure people don’t vote twice.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens

liveUpdates.text: The closeness of the Biden-Trump race in key states suggests that the 2016 outcome may have been less about Hillary Clinton’s political weaknesses than it was about Trump’s strengths.
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: Trump on Saturday morning was tweeting more baseless claims about election irregularities, focusing his ire on Pennsylvania, where a loss would seal his fate as a one-term president.
liveUpdates.author: Michael D. Shear

liveUpdates.text: Biden added to his margin in Fulton County, Ga., which includes most of Atlanta. He now leads by 7,248 votes in the state, with more than 98 percent of estimated votes reported.
liveUpdates.author: The New York Times

liveUpdates.text: Mark Meadows, the White House chief of staff who abided by Trump’s efforts to play down the coronavirus throughout the summer, has contracted the virus himself, a senior administration official said.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman

liveUpdates.text: Biden didn’t get to deliver a victory speech tonight, but he says as he concludes his brief remarks, “I hope to be talking to you tomorrow.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Biden tries to lower the temperature: “We may be opponents, but we’re not enemies. We’re Americans." He adds, “We have to put the anger and the demonization behind us.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Biden urges patience as votes are counted: “We’re proving again what we’ve proved for 244 years in this country: Democracy works. Your vote will be counted.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Biden says Americans have “given us a mandate for action.” He adds, “They made it clear they want the country to come together.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: The numbers “tell us a clear and convincing story,” Biden says in Wilmington. “We’re going to win this race.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Here in Wilmington, a number of top Biden aides have entered the room.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Election officials in both Philadelphia and Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) have stopped counting for the night and will resume Saturday morning.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: The elections chair in Erie County, Pa., said about 1,500 provisional ballots were cast there, and they’ve been about evenly split Trump-Biden. Biden’s lead will change little.
liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel

liveUpdates.text: Biden’s motorcade is en route to the Chase Center in Wilmington, where he is expected to speak shortly.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: A decade-long push by Stacey Abrams and voting rights activists played a major part in Joe Biden’s breakthrough in Georgia.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: Biden hasn’t been declared the winner, but he’s ramping up transition planning, and some potential top White House aides could be named as early as next week.
liveUpdates.author: Shane Goldmacher

liveUpdates.text: Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) just announced a new batch of ballots counted: 7,300 for Biden, 1,875 for Trump. Biden’s lead in Pennsylvania increases to 27,130 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel

liveUpdates.text: A number of top Biden officials and allies are on hand tonight in Wilmington, including Jake Sullivan and Steve Ricchetti, two of his close advisers, and Senator Chris Coons.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: In Arizona, Maricopa County just released another round of ballot results, and while Trump closed the gap slightly, it doesn’t put him on pace to capture the state.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to build on his lead in Pennsylvania, now leading the president by 21,705 votes after updates from Chester and Delaware counties outside Philadelphia.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Biden is expected to speak tonight regardless of the status of the uncalled races, campaign officials say.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Senator David Perdue is headed to a January runoff against Jon Ossoff, his Democratic challenger. The contest in Georgia could determine which party controls the Senate.
liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos

liveUpdates.text: David Perdue and Jon Ossoff have advanced to a runoff for the U.S. Senate race in Georgia.
A man working at a vote-counting site in Atlanta earlier this week has gone into hiding after being wrongly accused of discarding a ballot, his boss said.
liveUpdates.author: Sean Keenan

liveUpdates.text: Volunteers went door-to-door in Atlanta and elsewhere in Georgia today to help voters correct issues with their rejected absentee ballots, a process known as curing.
liveUpdates.author: Nicole Craine
liveUpdates.image_credit: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

liveUpdates.text: People familiar with the Biden campaign’s thinking say he may speak tonight even if the race isn’t called, but the tone will be shaped by the results that are in. Things are still fluid.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Officials in Maricopa County, Ariz., expect to release tens of thousands of newly recorded votes around 9 p.m. ET. The remaining votes there will be key to deciding a tight race.
liveUpdates.author: Matt Stevens

liveUpdates.text: Biden had planned to address the nation tonight, but there are indications he may well not do so until the race is called. Things are fluid here in Wilmington!
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: New ballots from Clark County (Las Vegas) expanded Biden’s lead in Nevada. I am not aware of a reason to believe that Trump can overcome his deficit in the state.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: The latest Arizona ballot releases aren’t looking great for Trump. Biden just led Yuma’s update. The problem for Trump? That’s a place where he led the count up till now.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: There are still 102,000 mail ballots to be counted in Pennsylvania. Additionally, there are at least 100,000 provisional ballots issued on Tuesday that have yet to be counted.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Biden nets 2,520 votes in the Las Vegas area, giving him a lead of over 22,000 in Nevada. Tens of thousands of ballots still to count, but they continue to go Biden’s way.
liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps

liveUpdates.text: I’m told Biden spent the day watching election results, meeting with aides and being with his family.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: The vote count has slowed to a crawl in key states, leaving Biden tantalizingly close to 270 electoral votes, but without a clear sense of when he might reach that number.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: The stage is set up and I believe I saw teleprompters, but with the race uncalled, the timing of when we’ll hear from Biden — who has emphasized the need to count every vote — appears fluid.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: The most contentious election night debates were once over networks calling the race before West Coast polls closed. As we watch decision desks hammered to make calls in PA, AZ, NV, that seems positively quaint.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: I don't think we're getting a call in Georgia for weeks, but we have such a good accounting of remaining ballots that Trump may need a tabulation error to win.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Biden gains more ground in Georgia, netting 2,725 votes in Gwinnett County, a blue-leaning suburb of Atlanta. He now leads Trump by more than 4,000 votes in the state.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Important amid lawsuits in Pa.: Ballots arriving after Election Day are segregated. They are then processed and counted separately, and, for now, not added to the current totals.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: David Perdue, Republican incumbent in Georgia, is “excited for overtime,” his campaign manager said, as he pledged to beat Jon Ossoff in a Senate runoff he hoped to avoid.
liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Fandos

liveUpdates.text: The right is criticizing the Philadelphia count, but Trump's on track to outdo his 2016 showing there, probably due to gains with nonwhites like those he's making elsewhere.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Carolyn Bourdeaux, a two-time Democratic candidate and college professor, flipped an open House seat in Georgia that had become a top priority for Democrats.
liveUpdates.author: Neil Vigdor

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s strategy in Pa. was finding voters who didn’t turn out in 2016. Looks like he succeeded. Unfortunately for him, he also turned out many first-time voters who oppose him.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Don’t expect a call soon on Georgia. It’s tight, and the secretary of state said there would be a recount. This one might not be called until the results are certified.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Star-shaped balloons are now affixed to the security barrier at the outdoor site where Biden is expected to speak tonight in prime time. A crowd is already forming.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Carolyn Bourdeaux, Democrat, wins Georgia’s Seventh Congressional District.
Nevada’s Clark County, home to Democratic stronghold Las Vegas, still has 63,000 ballots to be counted. So far every update from Clark has helped Biden. Next update by 7 p.m. ET.
liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps

liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia officials said that the remaining 40,000 ballots there fall into three categories: they require review, are provisional or are from military or overseas voters.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Mayor Jim Kenney of Philadelphia said the Trump campaign “has not produced one iota of evidence” of voter fraud in the city.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia officials said they’d release another update of votes from the city today, between 2,000 and 3,000 votes. The remaining 40,000 votes could take a few more days.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she has not spoken to Biden about a transition, telling reporters, “He doesn’t do anything until — and that, even to discuss — just until.”
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden plans to speak tonight during prime time, a campaign official says.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Good afternoon from Wilmington. The scene on the ground: growing activity and Biden supporters angling to catch a glimpse of the man they hope will be president-elect.
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: Jeff Van Drew, Republican, wins re-election in New Jersey’s Second Congressional District.
Mike Noble, a Phoenix-based pollster, told me: “That’s a wrap for the presidential contest in AZ. Trump needed almost 60% on this ballot drop, he got very low 50s. #Ballgame.”
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: No one has projected Nevada for Biden, but Trump’s path to victory is now exceedingly narrow. Virtually all of the remaining vote is from Clark County, which is heavily Democratic.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Nevada’s Clark County, home to Las Vegas, just delivered big for Biden — he picked up nearly 20,000 votes, more than double what Trump received in this drop, and moved closer to clinching the state.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, another 5,000 votes are expected by late morning or early afternoon from Gwinnett County, a Democratic-leaning Atlanta suburb, according to a spokesman.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Trump wins the new Maricopa County, Ariz., ballots by just five points. Don't know if it’ll allow a race call, but that pace won’t cut it for the president to win the state.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: The new ballots reported in Arizona’s Maricopa County, which includes Phoenix, were not what Trump was hoping for — he needed to do much better to cut into Biden’s lead.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: At 11 a.m. Eastern time we’re expecting more results from Maricopa County (Phoenix), where the majority of Arizona’s uncounted votes remain.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: More than 4,000 votes are left to be counted in Georgia, as well as an unknown number of overseas and military ballots that are still arriving, an elections official said.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: With a narrow margin between candidates, “there will be a recount in Georgia,” the state’s top elections official said. Biden currently leads by about 1,500 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Good morning from Las Vegas. A protest at the election center last night was peaceful — no arrests. We’re expecting about 50,000 votes to be released at 9 a.m. here (noon ET).
liveUpdates.author: Dave Philipps

liveUpdates.text: A Biden spokesman says that if Biden wins and Trump refuses to concede, “The United States government is perfectly capable of escorting trespassers out of the White House.”
liveUpdates.author: Katie Glueck

liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign hints that no one should be expecting a Trump concession. “This election is not over,” a campaign attorney said in a statement.
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: Even the recent tallies of mail ballots from red counties in Pennsylvania have favored Biden, since many Democrats voted by mail. He netted 2,500 votes from Mercer County last night.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: There are 130,000 ballots left to count in Pennsylvania, many from Democratic-leaning areas. Allegheny County (Pittsburgh) has at least 37,000, and the Philadelphia suburbs have about 20,000.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Biden gained 27,396 votes in the latest update from Philadelphia, and Trump 3,760, putting Biden in the lead. There are still roughly 20,000 ballots to count in the city.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: The votes being counted in Pennsylvania do not include any mail ballots arriving after Nov. 3. Those are being kept segregated. This count is for votes in by Election Day.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Winning Pennsylvania would clinch the election for Biden regardless of what happens in any of the other states that remain to be called.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor

liveUpdates.text: Biden has pulled ahead in Pennsylvania, erasing a large Trump lead from Election Day. The remaining ballots to be counted are coming from heavily Democratic areas in the state.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: The slim margin of Biden’s current lead in Georgia falls squarely into recount territory in the state — 0.5 percent or under.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: The next few batches of votes to be counted could vault Biden past Trump in pivotal Pennsylvania. That raises a politically fraught question for the TV networks: When would they call the race?
liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler

liveUpdates.text: Election officials in Philadelphia said more vote totals would be released Friday morning from the roughly 54,000 outstanding ballots in the city.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, Biden increased his lead to 1,096 over Trump after another batch of ballots came in from Clayton County, a deep blue county just south of Atlanta.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: If Biden's lead holds in Georgia, he will be the first Democrat the state has backed in a presidential race since Bill Clinton in 1992.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Election workers in surburban Gwinnett County are expected to finalize its vote this morning. Gwinnett is a blue-leaning county and the vote there has been breaking 2-1 for Biden.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Some counties sent election workers home overnight, but those in Clayton counted through the early morning, the reason the county was responsible for pushing Mr. Biden into the lead in Georgia.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Georgia would be a landmark political and moral victory for Biden. But its short-term importance is purely mathematical: if it holds, it would block Trump from reaching 270 electoral votes.
liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler

liveUpdates.text: The votes that pushed Biden ahead of Trump in Georgia came from Clayton County, an overwhelmingly Democratic county and home to Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Biden is now in front by 917 votes in Georgia, overtaking Trump after a long night of counting. Absentee ballots from Clayton County, just south of Atlanta, broke heavily in his favor.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: As more votes were counted early Friday in Georgia, Biden is now trailing Trump by just 463 votes, narrowing a gap of more than 18,000 at the start of Thursday.
liveUpdates.author: The New York Times

liveUpdates.text: There are roughly 175,000 absentee ballots still to count in Pennsylvania, including more than 58,000 in Philadelphia. Major counties like Philadelphia will keep counting through the night.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s lead in Pennsylvania is now less than 24,000 votes after more results trickled in from Bucks and Delaware counties.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Democrats are urging voters in Georgia to fix absentee ballots that were rejected because of invalid or missing signatures before the deadline on Friday evening.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Crowley

liveUpdates.text: Another protest by supporters of President Trump unfolded on Thursday night in front of the Phoenix building where ballots were being counted in Arizona’s largest county.
liveUpdates.author: Simon Romero

liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia releases its first batch of results in hours, netting Biden more than 10,000 votes. The Trump lead in Pennsylvania is now around 26,000 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Of the votes yet to be counted in Georgia, more than 5,000 come from Clayton County, a heavily Democratic area south of Atlanta.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to close the gap with Trump in Georgia, where the president’s margin has shrunk to 1,902 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: With more votes coming in from Monroe County in eastern Pennsylvania, Trump’s margin in the state is down to 42,000 — with at least 208,000 ballots left to count statewide.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Maricopa County will post its next report Friday at 11 a.m. ET. Officials there say they have 204,000 more early ballots to process, and a smaller number of provisional and other ballots.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: With the update we just got from Maricopa County, Biden’s margin over Trump in Arizona has narrowed to 1.5 points from 2.4 points this morning. About 46,000 votes separate them.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: With another batch of votes in Maricopa County (Phoenix), Biden’s lead in Arizona has shrunk. These are the last votes expected to be reported by Maricopa tonight.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to gain ground in Georgia. Trump now leads there by just 2,497 votes. Another 16,105 votes remain to be counted.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor

liveUpdates.text: Biden continues to improve in Pennsylvania, where he just picked up a net of 2,500 votes in red Mercer County, where Trump currently has 63 percent of the vote.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Around 9 p.m Eastern time we’re expecting more results from Maricopa County (Phoenix), where the majority of Arizona’s uncounted votes remain.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s lead in Pennsylvania is down to just over 50,000, with at least 250,000 mail ballots left to count in the state.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, where Trump’s lead over Biden has shrunk to 3,486, only 18,936 ballots remain uncounted, according to Jordan Fuchs, the deputy secretary of state.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s margin continues to shrink in Pennsylvania as Biden surges in Philadelphia’s suburbs. Updates from Delaware and Bucks counties gave Biden a net gain of 5,400 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: A federal judge denied the Trump campaign’s request to stop vote counting in Philadelphia, but officials agreed to expand the number of people each side could have in the room.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s remarks had a farewell tone to them as he listed all the obstacles that he is blaming for any loss. The downbeat contrast from his election night tone was startling.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: In his first remarks to reporters in two days, Trump delivered a brief statement filled with egregious falsehoods and smears about the election process.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Haberman

liveUpdates.text: More votes have been reported in Chatham and Clayton Counties, narrowing Trump’s lead in Georgia to less than 4,000.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor

liveUpdates.text: Erie County, Pa., a bellwether county that voted for Trump in 2016, just flipped to Biden. Trump’s lead in Pennsylvania is now less than 74,000.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor

liveUpdates.text: The three major networks — ABC, CBS and NBC — have all cut away after Trump made false claims in an appearance at the White House.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum

liveUpdates.text: Biden won a new batch of votes from Cumberland County, Pa., by a margin of nearly 70 percent to 30 percent, narrowing Trump’s lead in the state to less than 80,000.
liveUpdates.author: Maggie Astor

liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvania’s top election official says it may take longer than expected to complete the count there. Her office says about 326,000 mail ballots still need to be counted.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: John James, a Republican who ran against Senator Gary Peters of Michigan in a tight contest, is refusing to concede, citing vague and unsupported claims of cheating.
liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters

liveUpdates.text: In Georgia’s ongoing presidential vote tally, Biden continues to gain on Trump, narrowing the lead to fewer than 10,000 votes for the first time today.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: The Trump campaign filed suit in federal court seeking to stop the counting in Philadelphia, arguing that its observers were denied proper access. A hearing was set for 5:30 p.m.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: More than 35,000 mail-in ballots in Allegheny County, Pa. (Pittsburgh) will not be reported today, because of state rules and court orders.
liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel

liveUpdates.text: Nevada has about 190,000 ballots still to be counted, the secretary of state said. Ninety percent of them are from Clark County, where Biden currently leads by 8 percentage points.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Biden, in a brief statement to reporters, urged Americans to be patient as votes were counted and said he and Kamala Harris had “no doubt” that they would ultimately prevail.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s lead in Pennsylvania has fallen below 100,000 votes after additional results from Philadelphia and Erie counties. The secretary of state has promised an update this evening.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Why has The Times not called Arizona? The main reason: We do not believe there’s solid enough data on the votes that remain to be counted after Election Day.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Trump notched a minor victory in Pennsylvania when a court acceded to his campaign’s request to force Philadelphia election officials to grant its election observers better access.
liveUpdates.author: Jim Rutenberg

liveUpdates.text: “We can’t know how long the process will take,” said Gabriel Sterling, a Georgia election official. “We hope to have clarity on the outcomes of these elections as soon as possible.”
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Georgia still has 47,277 ballots remaining to be counted, an official with the secretary of state’s office said.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris are receiving a briefing on the coronavirus pandemic and an economic briefing at a theater in Wilmington. Both tested negative for the virus today.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: A Michigan judge denied a request from the Trump campaign to halt the counting of ballots in the state, pointing out that the tallying of absentee ballots was already completed.
liveUpdates.author: Kathleen Gray

liveUpdates.text: The registrar in Clark County (Las Vegas) said the county would release the next batch of votes around noon ET on Friday. Remaining votes include mail and provisional ballots.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvania’s secretary of state, Kathy Boockvar, said there are about 500,000 ballots yet to be counted and told CNN “we definitely could” know the winner by the end of Thursday.
liveUpdates.author: Glenn Thrush

liveUpdates.text: A superior court judge dismissed a lawsuit on Thursday filed by the Trump campaign that accused elections officials in Chatham County, Ga., of mishandling absentee ballots.
liveUpdates.author: Richard Fausset

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s lead in Georgia shrank to 13,540 votes on Thursday afternoon. The secretary of state said that about 50,000 votes now remain uncounted.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: With Biden slowly making gains in three key states, Trump issued a written statement, in all capital letters, making baseless claims that there could be fraud in the late votes.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Cooper

liveUpdates.text: With votes still being counted and no winner declared, Biden’s campaign manager, Jennifer O’Malley Dillon, told reporters today that her team’s data analysis indicated that Biden would prevail in the race.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: David Perdue has fallen under the 50 percent threshold to avoid a runoff in Georgia’s Senate race. He’s at 49.9997 percent — 141 votes short of winning outright with more votes still to be counted from Democratic areas.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: Ballot counting in Philadelphia was briefly halted after state Democrats appealed a ruling that allowed observers to watch the process. The state Supreme Court has not accepted or rejected the appeal. Counting resumed.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden’s lead in Nevada widened to about 12,000 votes after newly tabulated votes were reported in Clark County (which includes Las Vegas). More updates are expected today.
liveUpdates.author: Michael Gold

liveUpdates.text: Philadelphia election officials have not provided an update on when they’ll finish counting ballots, but next-door Bucks and Montgomery counties are nearing a full count.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Pennsylvania election officials plan to hold a news conference this afternoon. Democrats here are increasingly confident that Biden will have a big lead when all votes are counted.
liveUpdates.author: Nick Corasaniti

liveUpdates.text: Haley Stevens, Democrat, wins re-election in Michigan’s 11th Congressional District.
Gabriel Sterling, Georgia’s statewide voting system implementation manager, said that 61,367 outstanding mail-in absentee ballots remained uncounted. The state aims to finish its count by noon.
liveUpdates.author: Richard Fausset

liveUpdates.text: All eyes are on Georgia, and not just because of Trump’s dwindling lead. Senator David Perdue, Republican incumbent, may drop below 50%, which could force a Jan. runoff that could determine Senate control.
liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler

liveUpdates.text: Republicans in Georgia were nervously assessing the vote count and promised to file lawsuits in a dozen or more counties aimed at knocking off votes here and there.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: In the latest results, Trump hit the percentage he needed to stay on track to potentially win Arizona, but it may not hold. The next Maricopa release is not expected until Thursday night.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Biden’s margin in Maricopa County (Phoenix) went down by 10,783 votes, to a lead of 74,514 in the county.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: Maricopa County (Phoenix) just posted its last numbers for the night, and Trump narrowed Biden’s edge in Arizona slightly — to 68,390 votes, or less than three percentage points.
liveUpdates.author: Jennifer Medina

liveUpdates.text: More than 150 pro-Trump protesters, some armed, gathered outside the Maricopa County election office and chanted “Count the vote,” as officials continued to do just that.
liveUpdates.author: Simon Romero

liveUpdates.text: Calling on election officials to “count every vote,” protesters marched in several U.S. cities as Trump mounted an aggressive effort to challenge the vote count.
liveUpdates.author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

liveUpdates.text: Watching Democratic Twitter angst about Arizona’s race tightening. 1) Wait for more figures before freaking out. 2) Biden has multiple paths to victory. Trump’s road is narrow.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: The margin between Trump and Biden continues to narrow in Georgia. As of 10 p.m., Trump was leading by just 33,300 votes. Counting is continuing in the Atlanta metro region.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: In Georgia exit polls, 38 percent of voters characterized themselves as moderates. Of that group, 63 percent said they voted for Biden, while 34 percent said they supported Trump.
liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen

liveUpdates.text: Almost all of Georgia’s counties with appreciable outstanding votes are tinted blue on the map. This is why the White House is reportedly nervous about the state.
liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel

liveUpdates.text: Georgia has tightened to a 39,000-vote lead for Trump. Fulton County’s election director told CNN he expects to report all outstanding mail votes between midnight and 3 a.m.
liveUpdates.author: Trip Gabriel

liveUpdates.text: Officials in Maricopa County said they will release another results update after 1 a.m. ET, and another around 9 p.m. ET tomorrow.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: Roughly four out of 10 voters in Arizona consider themselves independent — and a majority of them voted for Biden over Trump.
liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen

liveUpdates.text: Arizona’s Maricopa County, where new results are starting to come in, saw its jobless rate fall to 6.3 percent in September, about half of what it was early in the pandemic.
liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen

liveUpdates.text: In Georgia, where the race is tightening, 45 percent of voters said they're doing better today than four years ago. In that group, nearly four of five supported Trump.
liveUpdates.author: Patricia Cohen

liveUpdates.text: Gary Peters, Democrat, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Michigan.
New results from Maricopa County are beginning to come in, with Biden maintaining a lead. This is just the beginning in Arizona, as 600,000 votes are still outstanding.
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Peter Meijer, Republican, wins Michigan’s Third Congressional District.
Richard L. Barron, the elections director of Fulton County, Ga., said he expected all votes there to be counted overnight, although it may stretch well after midnight.
liveUpdates.author: Jacey Fortin

liveUpdates.text: The presidential vote grows tighter in Georgia as mail ballots are counted. Trump’s lead has narrowed to 46,000 votes, or 1 percentage point.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Victoria Spartz, Republican, wins Indiana’s Fifth Congressional District.
Biden’s campaign, in another move to assert that he’s headed toward victory, has launched a transition team website. It borrows a theme from his campaign: BuildBackBetter.com.
liveUpdates.author: Sydney Ember

liveUpdates.text: After suggesting that they may release additional results on Wednesday, state officials in Nevada reverted to their original plan of updating results Thursday at noon Eastern.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: Could Trump still win? Not easy, not impossible. First: win Arizona (tough). Second: hold Georgia (very possible). Third: hang on in Pennsylvania (maybe).
liveUpdates.author: Adam Nagourney

liveUpdates.text: Speaker Nancy Pelosi acknowledged a “challenging election” in a letter to Democrats, after multiple first-term House Democrats lost their seats to Republicans.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s lead is down to 5 points in Pennsylvania. It’s not clear how much more counting there’ll be by nightfall, but his margin has already been more than cut in half today.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s lead in Georgia is down to 1.4 points with a lot of Democratic vote still out. Will be razor thin here, and a recount seems likely either way.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: With Nevada releasing additional ballots later today, Biden now has a reasonable path to clearing the 270 electoral vote threshold tonight.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Officials in Nevada had previously said that results would not be updated until Thursday morning, but they have since indicated they may release more today.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: Biden’s narrow win in Michigan was the product of extremely high turnout in Detroit, where an underwhelming performance with Black voters in 2016 helped doom Hillary Clinton.
liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters

liveUpdates.text: In winning Michigan, Biden has clawed back another state that was long part of the Democratic Party’s bulwark in the industrial North until Trump’s narrow 2016 victory.
liveUpdates.author: Jeremy Peters

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden has flipped Michigan, along with Wisconsin. Wins in Arizona and Nevada would get him to 270 electoral votes. Or, Pennsylvania would put him over the top.
liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer

liveUpdates.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Michigan.
Biden cites the turnout in Tuesday’s election and pays tribute to democracy. “Here, the people rule,” he says. “Power can’t be taken or asserted. It flows from the people.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: “I’m not here to declare that we’ve won, but I am here to report that when the count is finished, we believe we will be the winners,” Biden says in his speech.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: In a speech here, Biden says it’s “clear” that he will reach 270 electoral votes and win the presidency, though he stops short of claiming victory.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Biden is on his way to the Chase Center in Wilmington, where he will give remarks this afternoon.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: On Fox News, Chris Wallace tells viewers the WI pickup is key for Biden: “It’s real simple math now. Six votes in NV, 16 votes in MI, and he reaches precisely the magic number.” (Fox has called AZ for Biden.)
liveUpdates.author: Michael Grynbaum

liveUpdates.text: Officials in Maricopa County, which includes Phoenix, have said they will update results around 9 p.m. Eastern (7 p.m. local time) on Wednesday.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: We’ve gotten a bit more data in Pennsylvania, which narrows Trump’s lead to 8 points. To my mind, everything there is still consistent with Biden eventually taking the lead.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: The likeliest outcome by far in Arizona is that the remaining ballots are good enough for Biden. But I don’t think we can be 100 percent confident until we've seen some of them.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Trump’s campaign manager says he’ll request a recount in Wisconsin, though it may be up to two weeks before one can begin. In 2016 a statewide recount increased Trump’s margin by 131 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: Joe Biden has won Wisconsin, according to The Associated Press, flipping a state President Trump narrowly won in 2016.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr. wins Wisconsin.
Susan Collins becomes the first senator to be elected by Maine voters to a fifth term, and will become the longest-serving Republican woman in the history of the Senate.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Biden is now raising money for a new “Biden Fight Fund,” which will finance “election protection efforts for Joe Biden and Democrats up and down the ballot,” his campaign manager says.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Elissa Slotkin, Democrat, wins re-election in Michigan’s Eighth Congressional District.
Susan Collins, Republican, wins re-election to the U.S. Senate in Maine.
Sara Gideon, conceding the Senate race in Maine, tells supporters: “We built a movement that will help us make progress for years to come.” (The A.P. hasn’t called the race.)
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: Jared Golden, Democrat, wins re-election in Maine’s Second Congressional District.
Of the 200,000 uncounted votes in Georgia, most come from left-leaning areas of metropolitan Atlanta, suggesting they’re likely to skew Democratic.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: An estimated 200,000 votes remain uncounted in Georgia, officials say — that’s more than double Trump’s current margin over Biden in the state.
liveUpdates.author: Stephanie Saul

liveUpdates.text: Senator Susan Collins of Maine says she received “a very gracious call” from Sara Gideon, her Democratic opponent, conceding the race. The A.P. has not called a winner.
liveUpdates.author: Emily Cochrane

liveUpdates.text: The margin needs to be less than 1 percent for a recount in Wisconsin. Trump will have to pay about $3 million for it unless the margin is less than one quarter of 1 percent.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign manager Bill Stepien said in a statement that Trump “is well within the threshold to request a recount” in Wisconsin, and that the campaign planned to “immediately do so.”
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: There are only about 300 votes left to count in Wisconsin, officials say. They’re in the town of Willow in Richland County. Biden leads by more than 20,000 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: A new batch of votes reported this hour in Georgia has cut Trump’s lead there to just under 90,000 votes.
liveUpdates.author: Astead Herndon

liveUpdates.text: Biden has expanded his lead to more than 30,000 votes in Michigan, with a new batch coming in from Wayne County (Detroit). His current margin is bigger than Trump’s in 2016.
liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer

liveUpdates.text: Twitter slapped warnings on multiple presidential tweets and retweets this morning, warning that Trump’s statements about “surprise ballot dumps” were misleading.
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: Elaine Luria, Democrat, wins re-election in Virginia’s Second Congressional District.
Mondaire Jones, Democrat, wins New York’s 17th Congressional District.
Biden is expected to address the American people at some point today, his campaign manager, Jennifer O’Malley Dillon, tells reporters.
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Ashley Hinson, Republican, wins Iowa’s First Congressional District.

Trump campaign officials tell reporters that “if all legally cast ballots are counted, we believe the president will win.” They continue to describe Fox News, A.P. calls of Arizona for Biden as “just plain wrong.”
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: “If we count all legal ballots, the president wins,” Trump campaign manager Bill Stepien said on a call with reporters, and took no questions. The call came hours after Trump said he wanted to stop vote counting.
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: In a press briefing, Jennifer O’Malley Dillon, Biden's campaign manager, says, “Joe Biden is on track to win this election, and he will be the next president of the United States.”
liveUpdates.author: Thomas Kaplan

liveUpdates.text: Trump campaign manager Bill Stepien is projecting confidence in the president's chances in Wisconsin, Michigan, Nevada and Georgia. He said Wisconsin was headed to “recount territory.”
liveUpdates.author: Annie Karni

liveUpdates.text: In shot at Trump, Simon Coveney, Ireland’s foreign minister, said it would be unwise to claim victory before all votes counted. His U.K. counterpart, Dominic Raab, said the vote would provide a “definitive result.”
liveUpdates.author: Mark Landler

liveUpdates.text: Biden pulled ahead in Michigan, as another batch of votes rolled in from Wayne County, where Detroit is located. That heavily Democratic area is currently reporting about 70% of returns.
liveUpdates.author: Lisa Lerer

liveUpdates.text: Lauren Boebert, Republican, wins Colorado’s Third Congressional District.
Biden has won Pennsylvania absentee ballots by an overwhelming margin so far. If he carried the remaining absentee ballots by a similar margin, he would win the state.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Trump leads by nearly 700,000 votes in Pennsylvania. Biden’s chances there depend on whether he can win a large percentage of more than 1.4 million uncounted absentee ballots.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn

liveUpdates.text: Nevada’s election division announced that no more results will be given until noon Eastern on Thursday. Remaining votes include mail ballots received on Election Day.
liveUpdates.author: Alicia Parlapiano

liveUpdates.text: The absentee ballot results in Green Bay, Wis., are delayed because one of the vote-counting machines ran out of ink. An elections official had to return to City Hall to get more.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: After the city of Milwaukee reported its 169,000 absentee and early votes, Joe Biden pulled to a narrow lead in Wisconsin. Green Bay's early votes remain outstanding.
liveUpdates.author: Reid Epstein

liveUpdates.text: I don’t think people have fully internalized how Democratic these mail and absentee ballots will be in MI/PA/WI. It’s close, but these ballots will be overwhelmingly blue.
liveUpdates.author: Nate Cohn
